name: Vegetables
description: Rich in fiber, vitamins, and minerals. Vegetables are essential for digestion, disease prevention, and maintaining a healthy metabolism. They are low in calories and high in phytochemicals.

name: Fruits
description: Packed with natural sugars, vitamins, antioxidants, and fiber. Fruits help boost the immune system, improve skin health, and protect against chronic diseases. Best consumed fresh.

name: Grains
description: Primary source of carbohydrates and fiber. Grains like oats, rice, and wheat provide sustained energy, support digestive health, and contribute essential B vitamins and iron.

name: Proteins
description: Includes meats, poultry, fish, beans, and legumes. Proteins are critical for building and repairing tissues, hormone production, and maintaining muscle mass.

name: Dairy
description: Milk, cheese, yogurt, and other dairy products provide calcium, protein, and vitamin D, supporting bone strength, nerve function, and muscle health.

name: Oils and Fats
description: Healthy fats like olive oil, avocado, and nuts offer essential fatty acids, vitamin E, and energy. They support brain function, hormone balance, and nutrient absorption.

name: Vitamins
description: Organic compounds crucial for metabolism, immune function, and overall health. Includes Vitamin A (vision), Vitamin C (immunity), and B vitamins (energy production).

name: Minerals
description: Inorganic nutrients like calcium, potassium, iron, and magnesium. Minerals regulate heartbeat, bone strength, oxygen transport, and muscle contractions.

name: Spices and Herbs
description: Add flavor and medicinal benefits. Many spices like turmeric, garlic, and basil have anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties beneficial for overall health.

name: Beverages
description: Includes water, teas, and other non-alcoholic drinks. Hydration is essential for every body process, aiding in digestion, temperature regulation, and detoxification.

name: Supplements
description: Concentrated sources of nutrients or other substances with a nutritional effect, such as protein powders, multivitamins, or electrolytes. Useful to correct deficiencies.

name: Sweets and Snacks
description: Includes candy, baked goods, and processed snacks. High in sugars and fats, should be consumed moderately. Provides quick energy but low in nutrients.

name: Seafood
description: Rich in omega-3 fatty acids, proteins, and iodine. Fish and shellfish support brain health, reduce inflammation, and contribute essential nutrients for thyroid function.

name: Legumes
description: Includes beans, lentils, chickpeas, and peas. High in protein, fiber, iron, and folate, supporting muscle repair, heart health, and blood sugar control.

name: Tubers and Roots
description: Includes potatoes, sweet potatoes, and carrots. These are rich in starches, beta-carotene, and fiber, offering long-lasting energy and antioxidant support.

name: Nuts and Seeds
description: High in healthy fats, proteins, and fiber. Almonds, chia seeds, and walnuts support heart health, brain function, and satiety between meals.
